fields.description:
Similar in purpose to http://tortoisesvn.tigris.org/bigpicture.html#dirdiff

--------------------------------------------------------
Example Scenario:

t0: starting point, project_a is on trunk
branches/
trunk/project_a

t1: bug found, bug fix branch created for project_a
branches/bug_fix_project_a
trunk/project_a

t2: some bug fix changes committed to branches/bug_fix_project_a

t3: some unrelated changes committed to trunk/project_a

t4: changes from t3 are merged into branches/bug_fix_project_a

t5: more bug fix changes committed to branches/bug_fix_project_a

t6: at this point, branch is ready for review, i want a full-context and all-files code review between head of trunk/project_a and head of branches/bug_fix_project_a
--------------------------------------------------------

In the example above, I want to simply tell Crucible "make me a code review which shows all files and full context between http://my_svn_repo/trunk/project_a and http://my_svn_repo/branches/bug_fix_project_a at repo revision x".  I wouldn't want the changes from t4 in code review.


That feature would really help my team since most of our work occurs in "feature/fix" branches and is only merged in after review.

I realize that this new feature, if accepted, would take some time to complete.  In the meantime, can you recommend any tools which would allow me to create a full-context all-files patch file from the input parameters I described?


Thanks,

Luke
fields.summary: Add ability to create full-context, all-files code review from two URL paths and a repo revision number

fields.description:
Hi,

I have red about the "move review to another project" in the Crucible release note, which seems available
from Crucible 1.2 , but I could not figure it out how this function can be used, and the official Crucible (1.5.1)
documentation does not contain any description of this feature ... except the release note at the end of the document
referring to this feature:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-122

Regards,
Istvan
fields.summary: Move review to another project - again

fields.description:
I just clicked the Crucible icon next to a revision in FishEye that already had a Crucible review created for it. I expected this to take me through to the existing review because I interpreted the review number and Crucible icon were a 'single navigation unit'. I wasn't really thinking what I was doing and blindly filled out the review and approved it from draft status, not remembering I'd created a review for the same revision yesterday. I then realised my mistake and immediately abandoned the duplicate review.

I do understand now the Crucible icon will always create a new review but it wouldn't surprise me if others make the same initial mistake.

Perhaps the review number link and create link could be somehow modified to prevent people misinterpreting them as a 'single navigational unit'. Or maybe an intermediate screen that appears when clicking the new review icon for revisions that already have a review. The screen could note there is already a review for that revision and have two links:
* yes, take me to that review
* no, let me create a new review for this revision
fields.summary: Prevent duplicate reviews getting created from FishEye

fields.description: Currently you can create two projects with keys KEY and key which is probably bad, especially since we get keys insensitively.
fields.summary: Prevent two projects with same key different case

fields.description:
This happen in Crucible -> Manage files tab. It takes long time to show the Change Set for huge repository.

To reproduce: Create few large change sets (branch deletion) that involve more than 1000 files.
fields.summary: Improve the performance in retrieving Change set for review creation
Hide the branch management operations (create and delete) in reviews

fields.description: It would e nice to be able to copy/clone an existing project then edit the details.
fields.summary: Add copy project option

fields.description: Currently the default project is fixed, so you can't delete it. It would be nice to be able to set a project as the default project
fields.summary: Need to be able to set a project as default
Create Schema Upgrade to remove foreign key constraint as reqd. by delete project work

fields.description:
Scenario:
for a review I add many drafts of comments, at the end when I'm ready to publish them I click single button (Publish comments?) and all of them are being published.
Only one e-mail is sent with all of the comments.
fields.summary: Publish all drafts of comments with single button click.

fields.description:
Would be very handy to have nested comments within a review. 

"We were both put off by the lack of nesting of comments; it makes it hard to follow threading. We noticed this even though, except for a couple of comments, it was just the two of us; I'm sure this will be more noticeable with larger groups of reviewers."
fields.summary: Nested comments within review

fields.description:
Completion email says this:
CR-87 Christopher Owen  has completed this review. All reviewers are now complete.

Two problems.
# Reviewers are complete what?  Should "reviewers" be "reviews" or should it says All reviewers have completed their review?
# There are two spaces between the user's name and "has completed".  Looks a little yuk.  (Could be the user name ending in a space I guess)
fields.summary: Typo in email "reviewers are now complete"

fields.summary: Got fisheye and crucible problems.. not loading

fields.description:
When adding files to be reviewed there is no way to logically group them.  Instead, they are listed in the review in the order they are added.

It would be nice to be able to group and order (and be able to add comments for each group).  Something like this:

Configuration files: configuration files for iBatis
dummy.xml
dummy2.xml

Framework changes: changes to existing framework
class.java
class2.java

Junit changes: classes to test framework changes
test1.java
test2.java

Basically, we want to be able to group in any logical order.  We'd want to do this after the review is created (maybe before sent to moderator) as we want to be able to use the search feature to add classes.
fields.summary: Review File Order Feature

fields.description:
If you can create a review, but cannot be the moderator, the review initially shows you as the moderator anyway. When you edit the review details you don't appear in the moderator or author dropdowns, so the selected user changes without explaining why.

See https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-707
fields.summary: When a user has permission to create a review, but can't be the moderator, the user chosen as moderator changes confusingly

fields.description:
Crucible creates a new default "CR" project when it is started up, even if the user has deleted it previously.

Originally I had to rename the CR project to something else to turn it into a real project so it would not be hanging around. Now it seems when I start/stop Crucible it will create a new CR project for me which I then have to delete.

As long as there is one configured project, Crucible should not be creating a new default project every time it is launched
fields.summary: Crucible always creates a new default project after it is deleted

fields.description: It seems backwards to have review comments below the code. It would be nice to be able to place them above, to the left, etc.
fields.summary: Add an option to allow for the comments to be placed in different places.

fields.description: When doing a code review I usually like to view full source, and it is sometimes annoying to have to always hit the "view full source" link, and then start reviewing.
fields.summary: Add an option to "view full source" or "diff" by default.

fields.description:
In JIRA or Confluence, we can use the chinese language package, change the interface language to chinese.
But Crucible and FishEye does not provide the language package ? 

Most of our customers hope to use chinese interface. I hope  a way to localize Crucible and FishEye should be provided?
That is important to chinese language users.

Regards

Henry
fields.summary: Crucible should provide chinese language interface
Minimal OSGi Infrastructure
Remove 'All Projects' from projects dropdown

fields.description:
We've noticed that Crucible seems to run like a dog now and then.  I finally hooked up Fisheye+Crucible to use Yourkit, and traced for a few minutes.

I think _somehow_ a URL has gone rogue.  

I attach a Yourkit 7 snapshot of the state of play under our environment (we have 12 engineers).  Look for the JSP->Tag call that ends up calling com.cenqua.crucible.tags.AnnotatorTag.doStartTag().

Seems to be in one massive sort.

Not sure how else to help triage this, I have to restart Fisheye/Crucible when it gets like this.
fields.summary: [Performance] AnnotatorTag can hang in sort loop for (perhaps) large diffs

fields.description:
If the user only has a Crucible licence, fisheye functions should be disabled

Do the *minimum* needed to make this a reasonable configuration:

- message on root page
- hide some admin
- some user management changes
- setup changes
fields.summary: Turn FE Off When only Crucible licence is present
XWork Action Plugin Modules

fields.description: Perhaps implement SALL interfaces? Talk to Don Brown
fields.summary: Provide Plugin Authors with somewhere to store properties

fields.description: Add an attribute to users which indicates whether they are allowed to administer Fisheye/Crucible, and dispense with the global admin password.
fields.summary: Real Admin Users
Add Configuration UI to SVN Plugin, and Polish

fields.description:
Allow the administrator to specify that all reviews should have the contents of their files stored by Crucible. This decouples the reviews from the repository, so that you can restructure your repo, not renew your Fisheye licence etc.

Note that this task is a lower priority.
fields.summary: Optionally Store Files for all FileRevisions

fields.description: Provide REST API access to review item addition via file upload
fields.summary: Stored FRX REST API

fields.description: A new tab, similar to the Patch tab, which allows the addition of an item to the current review by uploading 1 or 2 files.
fields.summary: Stored FRX Create UI

fields.description:
Create a type of FRX which uses one or two uploads as the source of file revisions

- It should be presentable in the review UI as a normal FRX
- Allow binary files
- May use FileRevision objects? (talk to Matt)
fields.summary: Stored FRX Data Impl

fields.description:
This feature allows file revisions to be stored in Crucible, so that items in reviews are independent of the original source.

These will *optionally* be created during the process of creating a review from Light SCM revisions, or independently as a stand-alone review, similar to a patch review but created from one or two files instead of a diff.

The LightSCM feature will *not* depend on Stored FRXs, although some light SCM providers will certainly use them.
fields.summary: Stored FRX

fields.description:
This is the action which occurs when a revision displayed by the file or changeset browser is chosen by the user.

The action performed will probably differ from what Fisheye does, may be similar to patch creation.
fields.summary: Add Light SCM Revisions to Reviews

fields.description: Create a Mercury plugin for LightSCM
fields.summary: Hg Light SCM Plugin

fields.description: Create a LSCM plugin which allows the review of files on a file system visible to the server
fields.summary: Filesystem Light SCM Plugin

fields.description: Note that a single Light SCM plugin may provide a number of repositories
fields.summary: Default Repository for a Project can be a Light SCM repo

fields.description:
CVS implementation -- this will allow CVS pserver use

*This may move to the next iteration*
fields.summary: CVS Light SCM Plugin

fields.description:
Where we currently query for Fisheye repos, query for LightSCM plugins.

Add whatever is needed to the light SCM interface.
fields.summary: Light SCM Plugin instances appear in source/repository dropdowns

fields.description:
Need to decide whether to use svn command line or java API

A byproduct of this will probably be some utility classes of general interest to LSCM plugin developers.
fields.summary: Subversion LSCM plugin

fields.description:
A Plugin to create reviews for confluence changes.

Should allow browsing of a confluence instances spaces as though it was a directory tree, and browsing of recent changes.
fields.summary: Confluence LSCM Plugin

fields.description:
Make the file browser page work with Light SCM plugins:

- create an interface to be extended by the Light SCM plugin interface, and implemented by Fisheye repositories this interface will indicate what functions are available from the plugin/repo
- implement a test Light SCM plugin
- implement this interface for Fisheye Repos
- modify the UI to work with this interface, hiding features as required.
fields.summary: Modify File Browser to Use Light SCM Plugins

fields.description:
Make the change set browser page work with Light SCM plugins:

- create an interface to be extended by the Light SCM plugin interface, and implemented by Fisheye repositories
- this interface will indicate what functions are available from the plugin/repo
- implement a test Light SCM plugin
- implement this interface for Fisheye Repos
- modify the UI to work with this interface, hiding features as required.
fields.summary: Modify Changeset Browser to use Light SCM Plugins

fields.description:
Create a new plugin module type for Light SCM plugins.

The interface of Light SCM Plugins will eveolve over the course of this iteration
fields.summary: Create Light SCM Module Type

fields.description:
- Create a maven archetype which creates a framework Crucible plugin project
- Create a maven artifact which provides the Crcucible API classes needed by plugin developers. This should be a target in the ant build file which deploys to our public repository.
- Jonathan Nolen and the Cross product team should be consulted on the exact requirements for this, base poms to use, examples of existing archetypes and so on.
fields.summary: Maven Archetype for plugin developers

fields.description: Allow plugins to include a resource (a JSP fragment?) which is displayed in the Administration section, and some actions called by the page.
fields.summary: Admin Pages for Plugins

fields.description: Allow SCMs to be plugged in to Crucible
fields.summary: Light SCM

fields.description: We could improve the tests strictness by using xpath to check the returned XML
fields.summary: Use XPath instead of regexes for REST tests
pre-commit review improvement

fields.description: At present our Jersey REST classes are not Spring components, and so can't be injected. Jersey/Spring integration is being improved, so we should look at upgrading to the latest Jersey version and using Spring.
fields.summary: Integrate Jersey with Spring

fields.description:
At present an authorised user can delete the default project by changing the URL, even though the I doesn't show a delete link for the project.

We need to explicitly check that the project being deleted is not the default project (or should we allow its deletion, as long as there is another project, that project becoming the default project?)
fields.summary: Prevent deletion of default project
Write an integration test which exercises crowd integration, including trusted apps integration where the impersonated user is a crowd user

fields.description: Start Crucible and run the integration tests -- allow Bamboo to check the results
fields.summary: Automate Running of Integration Tests

fields.description: POST a GeneralCommentData to /reviews-v1/{id}/comments -- response is the newly created comment
fields.summary: Add General Comment via REST API

fields.description: Comment volume chart report of comments/defects is hard to reproduce on the comment search page leading to confusion if you choose the "same" time period on the comment search page.
fields.summary: Comment volume chart reports confusion

fields.description: in review creation, add an action to remove all revisions from the review.
fields.summary: create action to remove all revisions from a review

fields.description:
Add review filter based defect reports so a review author or moderator can find out how many defects have been found in his/her code.

add filter options to the comment/defect search
* review author 
* review moderator
fields.summary: review filter based defect reports

fields.description:
We're seeing a large amount of these exceptions in the debug log, one every couple of seconds.  I searched the existing Cru/Fisheye issues and couldn't seem to find anything related.

The Deployables folder no longer exists at HEAD, but we see this for other files in branches and Trunks that still exist.  This doesn't seem dependent on users accessing the application, it just seems to be constantly writing out.

fields.description:
clicking remove all revisions in  the manage files -> changesets tab reports "no revisions added or removed"

remove all revisions action should be available on all manage files tabs
fields.summary: Remove all Revisions in manager files-> Changesets tab doesn't work

fields.description: return replies as part of the CommentData object (Java API and remote REST API)
fields.summary: Return replies to comments via API

fields.description: Add an RSS feed to the project page. Either just for open reviews, or filter specific.
fields.summary: Project RSS feed

fields.description:
A customer has reported creating a review where an error is thrown when removing a file. https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-515

Notes:
* This review had two participants adding and removing the same files simultaneously.
* It looks like the database may not be consistent, but manual inspection did not pick up the problem
* A new review with the same files works fine
* I was not able to reproduce the problem locally with the users DB probably because I did not have the repository (so the files were not available avoiding the problem)
* the problem seems to be rare.

I suggest we set up some stress testing on adding/deleting files simultaneously to try and reproduce and identify the problem.
fields.summary: Database may become corrupted on a particular review, not allowing adding/removing files

fields.description: Directions described at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Integrating+with+Other+Web+Servers do not produce a working configuration. I am unable to front crucible by Apache using ProxyPass.
fields.summary: following the directions to integrate with the Apache web server does not result in working setup

fields.description:
!http://img.skitch.com/20080418-qm7pknii3521xpu7yc899ux473.png!

I've worked around by specifying 144 as the height when calling defectMetricReport.
fields.summary: Height not respected if less than 144 in defect chart

fields.description:
The sparklines (other than the pie chart) are being served as application/octet-stream instead of image/png I suspect this will break rendering in some browsers (for instance you can't right click view image) especially with strict security settings.

!http://img.skitch.com/20080418-my6yurgumq5d8x3sfgai4wajj9.png!
fields.summary: Sparklines have wrong content type

fields.description:
The stats in 1.5 can indicate if you have a problem with your review process. I.e. too many open reviews, too many open for too long etc etc.  In the case of FishEye I want a report that tells me where the bottlenecks are. An obvious one is a report showing me the age of the reviews (i.e. the detail for the age chart). 

The open reviews could be broken down by reviews where all reviewers are complete and those that have outstanding reviewers. The first would be split by moderator (as they are the bottleneck) and the second could be by reviewers that aren't complete. See dodgy mockup attached.

The point would be to identify the people responsible for the tardiness. Further filtering would help too (e.g. exclude reviews less than x days old etc).
fields.summary: People to kick reports

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20080418-q9a5uxktb15866dbm1bk9bd1ut.jpg!
fields.summary: Review Stats Wrong

On my dashboard the open review filter and drafts filter are out by 1

fields.summary: Personal dashboard stats don't match

After the start of the server with the new Crucible-Fisheye v1.5  release, when the UI (Fisheye Dashboard) is checked,the following 
error message appears in the browser: 
   HTTP ERROR: 503
   SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
   RequestURI=/

   Powered by jetty://

The fisheye-error.log does not contain any log at all, but the fisheye.out log file has the following exception:

6239 [main] INFO / - Initializing Spring root WebApplicationContext
10007 [main] INFO / - org.tuckey.web.filters.urlrewrite.UrlRewriteFilter INFO: loaded (conf ok)
11671 [main] WARN org.mortbay.log - failed CXFServlet
javax.servlet.ServletException: org.apache.cxf.service.factory.ServiceConstructionException
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.initServlet(ServletHolder.java:437)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.doStart(ServletHolder.java:256)
        at org.mortbay.component.AbstractLifeCycle.start(AbstractLifeCycle.java:40)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler.initialize(ServletHandler.java:612)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.Context.startContext(Context.java:139)
....
        at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.rpc.CrucibleCXFServlet.init(CrucibleCXFServlet.java:19)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.initServlet(ServletHolder.java:433)
        ... 26 more
Caused by: com.sun.xml.bind.v2.runtime.IllegalAnnotationsException: 1 counts of IllegalAnnotationExceptions
The type of the getter is com.atlassian.crucible.spi.PermId<com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedLineCommentData> but that of the setter i
s java.lang.String. They have to be the same.
        this problem is related to the following location:
                at public com.atlassian.crucible.spi.PermId com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedCommentData.getPermaId()
                at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedCommentData
                at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedLineCommentData
        this problem is related to the following location:
                at public void com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedCommentData.setPermaId(java.lang.String)
                at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedCommentData
                at com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.VersionedLineCommentData
...

Using the standalone Fisheye package (fisheye-1.5.zip md5sum: 428aac1b9524a629c9aaaf45330d9f32 )
the instance started properly without any exceptions in the log files, the Fisheye dashbord shown without any error.

Defect pie chart on comment search page includes non-defect comments.

fields.description: Create a Plugin Module type which supports REST plugins.
fields.summary: Create REST Plugin Module Type

fields.description:
Managing projects is a real pain.  And it seems disjointed to have a rich permissions set for the reviews themselves with roles, but to not have an administrative role.

There should be an admin role that you could potentially link to users/groups so you can allow updating of projects, etc. from within Crucible without using a global administrator login and a separate UI.
fields.summary: Create Admin permission instead of global admin user

fields.description:
It would be really useful if there was a group that every Crucible user was always a member of, such as "All Users" so you could add that to Allowed Reviewers, for example.  But right now, you have to create your own group and add users to it and then constantly update it as users come onto the system.

You know, it would also be nice to be able to add users to a group from the group create/edit screen instead of having to edit every user individually.
fields.summary: Create default "All Users" group

fields.description: Using LDAP for authentication is nice, but currently group creation and management is a complete manual effort.  Crucible should be able to use LDAP groups instead of just built-in groups.
fields.summary: Allow using LDAP groups for access management

fields.description: need a permission for whether you can view/access a project at all. This should impact dropdowns, searches etc.
fields.summary: need a "view project" permission
Next/Previous comment arrows should appear disabled when there is no next or previous comment

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: can't search for review keys in quicksearch

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: [CSS] project list a little wonky in IE

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: In IE, "view diff to latest" partially obscured

fields.description: the current red square icon looks less than desirable. Make a nicer icon to visually represent that the file under review has a newer revision.
fields.summary: create a better looking indication icon

fields.description:
It would be great if there was some option to automatically assign reviewers. For example, when you open a new review crucible assigns reviewers based on how many reviews they already have, some other rules (include senior programmer, last person who edited this file besides author, etc). We are testing crucible in our company (we have JIRA, Confluence and Bamboo already), but it seems a little incomplete (as compared to the other products), it's hard to put the finger on exactly what (beyond what's mentioned), but the workflow in crucible is not fluid as the other tools. 
I also think an IDE integrations would really help (like opening a review as part of the commit to SVN etc).
fields.summary: Reviewer Auto Suggest

fields.description: When I try to copy from a review, all the lines I have selected become part of a comment. This is a nice feature, but shift+drag (or something) should simply select the lines so I can copy them (to possibly put in an email, find that line in the source, or whaterver.)
fields.summary: Copy and paste is not working

fields.description:
When I open a file in it's own tab, I often want to refer to a different file. When I click on the review tab, my file tab is closed and I have to open it again, incurring load times again, etc.

Crucible should keep the tab open so I can refer to various files.
fields.summary: Clicking on review tab closes the file tab.

fields.description: On the review tab, there is a link called 'Jump to first comment.' However when I open the file in it's own tab, the link is not there.
fields.summary: No 'Jump to first comment' link on the file tab.
Add Project Dropdown to Search Pages
Create 'Reviews Started' Pie Chart for Project Dashboard

fields.description:
If there is 102 files in the change set, 'Manage Files' tab in Crucible Review displays message "Note: only showing 100 of 102 files in the above changeset."
Selecting the checkbox for the entire changeset only adds the 100 visible files to the review, not the entire changeset files. 

2 way to add all 102 files :
# Go into fisheye and create the review from the changeset, then it will include all 102 files.
# Add the particular additional file (not included in the '100' listings) by go to 'Files' tab and select the file that want to review from the specific path. his will append the additional files to the 100 changeset files in the review.
fields.summary: Cannot choose file for review from Manage Files tab if there are more than 100 files in the change set.

fields.description:
isn't the setting really "check 'Allow anyone to join' in new reviews by default"

?
fields.summary: "let allowed participants join review" misleading verbage in admin

fields.description: And make the range set in one place
fields.summary: Make Project Dashboard Charts cover 14 days instead of 7

fields.description: Only the first comment in a section has a reply button, at least in the case I am looking at now: see attached screenshot, which is from https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/cru/CR-603
fields.summary: Allow threaded comments in reviews

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: sidebyside diff line numbers must be aligned to the top

fields.description: Another big complaint from the team with using Crucible is that's its a PITA to use for large reviews, especially if the review is somewhat iterative (ie: comments on day one, responses on day one, more comments in response or brand new on day two, responses on day two, etc...).  There's no good way to see the newest comments (ie, ones you didn't already respond to or ignored).  If there was a way of viewing comments by the date they were entered, it would be very helpful for getting back into a review after you've already done a portion of it.
fields.summary: List Comments By Time Created

fields.description: The single-largest complaint I hear from the team while using Crucible is that it is almost impossible to use it in real-time.  If you've opened the review and then someone else commented, you have to reload the entire review in order to see the comment.  There should be some kind of ajaxian magic going on behind the scenes that auto-includes newer comments, auto-removes deleted ones, and auto-updates edited ones.
fields.summary: Update In Real Time
